quest.name: Two Nations, One Seed
journal: Mujih Mewrilah has received word of another task from Basyle.
Mujih informs you that Basyle has need of your expertise once more. Speak with the botanist at Camp Cloudtop and inquire after the particulars.

Basyle explains to you his latest dilemma: in order to maintain soil fertility, he wishes to grow crops of the bean family at regular intervals. However, such varieties of beans as are found in Coerthas refuse to grow in the Sea of Clouds. Based on your recommendation, Basyle asks you to return to Gridania to trouble Fufucha for advice.

Fufucha believes that the Shroud vetch would be best suited to Basyle's needs. Even so, she does not think it entirely ideal, and suggests that you find another strain with which to cross it and create a new variety. To this end, you must seek the counsel of a specialist─an Ishgardian native versed in local flora. During her time in Ishgard, Mujih may have come to know of such an individual; seek the reporter out at the aetheryte plaza in Foundation.

Most fortuitously, Mujih knows just the person you are looking for─the foremost herbalist in Ishgard, a man named Martineau. She offers to arrange a meeting with him, and instructs you to go to Saint Reymanaud's Cathedral, where he will supposedly be.

Having marveled at the fine specimens of Shroud vetch, Martineau gives you his recommendation for a crossing match: emerald beans, which can be harvested from lush vegetation in the Churning Mists. Procure ten handfuls of these beans and deliver them to Basyle.

Basyle receives the Shroud vetch and emerald beans with thanks. Though it will require time and effort to cross them, he believes that it will be worthwhile in the end. In parting, he informs you that Mujih has left a message asking you to meet her at the aetheryte plaza in Ishgard.

With great satisfaction, Mujih informs you that the second installment in her series is on its way to The Raven. She praises you for your part in Basyle's recent successes, and bids you keep up your efforts.

※The next botanist quest will be available from Mujih Mewrilah upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Basyle at Camp Cloudtop.
Speak with Fufucha at the Botanists' Guild.
Speak with Mujih Mewrilah at the aetheryte plaza in Ishgard.
Speak with Martineau in Saint Reymanaud's Cathedral.
Harvest emerald beans in the Churning MistsDeliver the emerald beans and Shroud vetch to Basyle at Camp Cloudtop.
Report to Mujih Mewrilah at the aetheryte plaza in Ishgard.

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Ah, I was hoping you'd come by! Basyle has another task for you!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Just so you know, I won't be accompanying you from now on. While you go about your gathering, I've a mind to do some gathering of my own─for information here in the Holy See!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Having said that, I will require a report from you afterwards, so be sure to remember all the juicy details. Now, off you go to Camp Cloudtop!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Though I won't be accompanying you from now on, I will require a report from you afterwards, so be sure to remember all the juicy details. Now, off you go to Camp Cloudtop!

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: My thanks for your help the other day, Forename. I'm pleased to report that the cyclops onions are coming along nicely.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: This time, I need your help to maintain soil quality. As you know, soil gradually becomes barren with continued cultivation.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: In order to keep it fertile, we normally grow crops of the bean family at regular intervals.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: Alas, such beans as we have in Coerthas refuse to grow here. Unless we do something, I fear the soil will cease to yield crops altogether. Is there aught you can suggest?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you suggest?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Try growing a Gridanian variety of beans.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Request seeds from the Botanists' Guild.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: But of course! We've managed to grow gysahl greens from Gridanian seeds─perhaps this success can be repeated with beans.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: But of course! The Botanists' Guild has a veritable treasure trove of seeds from all regions. There's bound to be something among them that will grow in these parts.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to trouble you, Forename, but could you please travel to Gridania and consult Fufucha? If anybody knows a strain of beans to suit our needs, it will be she.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: Could you please travel to Gridania and consult Fufucha? If anybody knows a strain of beans to suit our needs, it will be she.

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: Ah, if it isn't the toast of the guild! Aye, I have read all about your recent exploits in The Raven. You have been away only a short while, and already you have achieved so much! We all of us here are very proud of you!

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: ...Oh? Embellished? Well, I suppose that is simply the way of Mujih's profession. And though her words may have been flowery, I choose to believe that they are firmly rooted in truth.

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: In any case, all seems to be well with you, and for that I am glad. Now then, was there something you wished to talk about?

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Cover crops for revitalizing soil, and those that will grow in the Sea of Clouds besides... This is a difficult order to fill.

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: From my experience, I would say that Shroud vetch would be best suited. Even so, it is not entirely ideal.

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: Nay, it must be crossed with a highland strain to create what Basyle needs.

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: Now, rather than crossing strains haphazardly, I suggest you seek the counsel of a specialist─that is, an Ishgardian native versed in the local flora.

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: Show to him this bundle of Shroud vetch, and he should be able to provide you with the name of a suitable match.

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: As to where you might find such an individual, I daresay Mujih will be the best person to ask. It is her business to know people, after all.

dialogue.name: FUFUCHA
dialogue.text: I daresay Mujih will know of an Ishgardian specialist versed in the local flora. You would do well to speak with her.

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: ...Fufucha suggested that you come to me? Ooh, she's a sharp one!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Indeed, it's my business to know people, and I happen to know just the person you're looking for!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Martineau is his name, and he's no less than the foremost herbalist in all of Ishgard! I'll arrange a meeting right away!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Actually, I wonder if it's appropriate to intervene in the doings of my subject... Ah, never mind the details─they're the bane of a good story!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: I'll have Martineau come and meet you in Saint Reymanaud's Cathedral. Off you go, Forename!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: I'll have Martineau come and meet you in Saint Reymanaud's Cathedral. Off you go, Forename!

dialogue.name: MARTINEAU
dialogue.text: You are the botanist who wished to speak with me? Hm, you certainly appear capable, as your frenetic friend led me to believe.

dialogue.name: MARTINEAU
dialogue.text: I always enjoy the chance to engage with fellow lovers of nature. And being a researcher, I welcome the insights of gatherers like your good self. But come, I am given to understand you seek advice on crossing strains of beans.

dialogue.name: MARTINEAU
dialogue.text: I had always held the Botanists' Guild in the highest regard. Seeing such fine specimens serves to reaffirm that sentiment.

dialogue.name: MARTINEAU
dialogue.text: As Mistress Fufucha has already concluded, the Shroud vetch will not prosper in the Sea of Clouds. It must needs be crossed with another strain to bring out its resilience.

dialogue.name: MARTINEAU
dialogue.text: I would recommend emerald beans, a rare strain which grows in the Churning Mists. For your purposes, you will need perhaps ten handfuls.

dialogue.name: MARTINEAU
dialogue.text: And with that, I trust you now know what is required. Should you have further questions, do not hesitate to seek me out again.

dialogue.name: MARTINEAU
dialogue.text: For your purposes, you will need perhaps ten handfuls of emerald beans. Should you have further questions, do not hesitate to seek me out again.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: Miss Mujih tells me you managed to get Master Martineau's advice, even though he's notoriously elusive. You truly are dedicated to our cause, my friend.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: Ah, so these are emerald beans! If I understand correctly, the plan is to cross these with Shroud vetch. Do you have the latter as well?

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: Marvelous! My thanks, Forename! I shall set about cross-pollinating them at once!

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: The process will require considerable time and effort, but I'm confident that it will be worthwhile in the end.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: Ah, before I forget, Miss Mujih left a message for you. She bids you come and meet her at the aetheryte plaza in Ishgard.

dialogue.name: BASYLE
dialogue.text: Miss Mujih awaits you at the aetheryte plaza in Ishgard.

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename, and good work! Not only did you help Basyle solve another problem, you served as a bridge connecting the people of Gridania and Ishgard!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: In case you're wondering, I've already sent off the draft for the second installment in my series. It's bound to be as successful as the first, and there's not a hint of fabrication in there! Embellishments? Certainly! But no fabrication!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: “Two Nations, One Seed”─that's the title I have in mind. Simple but powerful, even if I do say so myself!

dialogue.name: MUJIHMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Of course, my story is secondary to all your hard work. Basyle's crops are coming along well, and it's in no small part due to your efforts. For his sake, please keep it up!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In blazing new trails as a botanist, you have learned “Luck of the Pioneer”!
